4. Supports mediation efforts led by President Yoweri Museveni of Uganda and stresses close coordination between the region and international facilitators.

5. Welcomes the Secretary-General's appointment of a Special Advisor on Conflict Prevention to support an inclusive dialogue and peaceful resolution.

6. Intends to consider additional measures against Burundian actors whose actions perpetuate violence and impede a peaceful solution.

7. Stresses the importance of the Secretary-General closely following the situation and deploying a team to assess the situation and develop options.

8. Requests the Secretary-General to update the Council within 15 days on options for a UN presence in Burundi and regularly on the situation.

9. Affirms the importance of UN and African Union contingency planning to respond to further deterioration.

10. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
